properties.occ_summary: WHILE PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD AT 22 MPH ON THE THREE HILLS SUBDIVISION, CN FREIGHT Q-115-31-18 EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 13.50. UPON INSPECTION THE CREW DISCOVERED 7 CARS DERAILED (13 CAR BODIES) INCLUDING INTERMODAL FLAT CAR DTTX 785225 WITH CONTAINERS TWEU 453122, LOAD OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE, UN 3262, TGHU 780784, LOAD OF PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, UN 1263 AND VITU 153382, LOAD OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION, UN 1824. NO INJURIES OR LEAKAGE OF PRODUCT REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (CALGARY) DEPLOYED.

WHILE PROCEEDING EASTWARD AT 25 MPH ON THE MONTREAL SUBDIVISION, OVER THE SOUTH TRACK TO NORTH CONNECTING TRACK CROSSOVER, CN FREIGHT M-310-31-23 EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION. UPON INSPECTION, THE CREW DISCOVERED 6 CARS DERAILED INCLUDING TANK CAR GATX 35283, RESIDUE L/C AVIATION FUEL, UN 1863. NO INJURIES OR LEAKAGE OF PRODUCT REPORTED. CN OFFICALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (DORVAL, QUEBEC) DEPLOYED.

AMT COMMUTER TRAIN 805, OPERATING ON CN'S ST-HYACINTHE SUBDIVISON, DERAILED LOCOMOTIVE AMT 1352 AND COACH AMT 3000, WHILE ENTERING TRACK 22 AT MONTREAL CENTRAL STATION. NO INJURIES TO CREW OR PASSSENGERS ON BOARD. CN / AMT OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATOR (DORVAL) DEPLOYED.

CN FREIGHT Q-101-31-21, PROCEEDING WESTWARD AT 25 MPH ON THE WAINWRIGHT SUBDIVISION, STRUCK THE TAIL END OF CN FREIGHT A-417-51-23 AT MILE 262.30. AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION, 2 INTERMODAL FLAT CARS DERAILED (3 CAR BODIES) AND LOCOMOTIVE CN 2234 WAS DAMAGED. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATOR (EDMONTON) DEPLOYED.

QUEBEC NORTH SHORE & LABRADOR RAILWAY REPORTS, FREIGHT PL-485 EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 56.40 OF THE WACOUNA SUBDIVISION WHILE PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD AT 30 MPH. UPON INSPECTION BY THE CREW, 17 CARS WERE DISCOVERED DERAILED. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. QNS&L OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (QUEBEC AND HEAD OFFICE) DEPLOYED.

QUEBEC NORTH SHORE & LABRADOR RAILWAY REPORTS, THE LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER ON FREIGHT LS-55-0 INITIATED AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AND CAME TO A STOP AT MILE 67 OF THE WACOUNA SUBDIVISION. AFTER BEING STOPPED FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 HOUR THE TRAIN BEGAN TO ROLL UNCONTROLLED AND ATTAINED A TOP SPEED OF 63 MPH BEFORE COMING TO A STOP AT MILE 52. NO INJURIES OR DERAILMENT REPORTED. QNSL OFFICIALS RESPONDED.

PASSENGER VIA TRAIN 70 TRAVELLING EASTWARD STOPPED AT OAKVILLE STATION FOR A PASSENGER STOP, AND THE CREW NOTICED SMOKE COMING FROM ONE OF THE WHEELS. FURTHER INSPECTION REVEALED A HOT BEARING. THE CAR (VIA 4009) WAS SET OFF AT OAKVILLE. THERE WERE 106 PASSENGERS ON BOARD. NO INJURIES. TSB INVESTIGATORS RICHMOND HILL DEPLOYED THE NEXT DAY, TO WHERE THE CAR WAS SET OFF.

VIA PASSENGER TRAIN 51, PROCEEDING WESTWARD AT 96 MPH ON THE SOUTH MAIN TRACK OF METROLINX'S KINGSTON SUBDIVISION, STRUCK AND FATALLY INJURED A CN ENGINEERING SERVICES EMPLOYEE PERFORMING WORK ON THE NORTH MAIN TRACK. LOCAL EMERGENCY SERVICES AND VIA / METROLINX / CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (HEAD OFFICE) DEPLOYED.

THE CN TRAIN CREW ON FREIGHT Q-102-51-10 REPORTED THAT AS THE WERE PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD ON THE BALA SUBDIVISION, THEY EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 241-88. UPON INSPECTION 11 INTERMODAL FLAT CARS (34 CAR BODIES) WERE DISCOVERED DERAILED. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (TORONTO) DEPLOYED.

VIA PASSENGER TRAIN 71, PROCEEDING AT 79 MPH ON THE SOUTH MAIN TRACK OF CN'S CHATHAM SUBDIVISION, STRUCK A PICK-UP TRUCK ON PRATT SIDING ROAD PUBLIC CROSSING EQUIPPED WITH SRCS. AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION THE LONE OCCUPANT IN THE VEHICLE SUSTAINED SERIOUS INJURIES AND LOCOMOTIVE VIA 915 AND 4 COACHES DERAILED. IT WAS ALSO REPORTED THAT 7 PASSENGERS ON VIA 71 SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES. LOCAL POLICE, AMBULANCE AND CN / VIA OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (TORONTO, GATINEAU) DEPLOYED.
THE CREW OF TRAIN C75151-11 REPORTED DERAILING 36 LOADED CARS OF COAL WEST OF ENCOMBE, BC. SOME OF THE CARS ARE ON THEIR SIDE AND SOME ARE BLOCKING A CROSSING. NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.

CN FREIGHT C-765-51-20, WHILE PROCEEDING WESTWARD ON THE NECHAKO SUBDIVISION, EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 58.90. UPON INSPECTION THE CREW DISCOVERED 19 CARS DERAILED. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATOR (VANCOUVER) DEPLOYED.

CP FREIGHT 353-267, PROCEEDING WESTWARD ON THE NORTH MAIN TRACK OF THE MOUNTAIN SUBDIVISION EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 41.70. UPON INSPECTION, THE CREW DISCOVERED 34 CARS DERAILED. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT THE CARS WERE ALSO FOUL OF THE SOUTH TRACK. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CP OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATOR (CALGARY) DEPLOYED.

CN REPORTS, VIA PASSENGER TRAIN P-692-41-29, IN POSSESSION OF AN OCS CLEARANCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ENTER THE SIDING A MEHARRY, PASSED THE WEST SIDING SWITCH MEHARRY AND CONTINUED ON THE MAIN TRACK FOR 3 MILES. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT THE PASSENGER TRAIN WAS BROUGHT TO A STOP WHEN OPPOSING CN FREIGHT TRAIN G-853-41-28 CAME INTO VIEW. BOTH TRAINS WERE SAFELY BROUGHT TO A STOP. VIA 692 THEN MADE A RESERSE MOVEMENT AND ENTERED THE SIDING AT MEHARRY FROM THE EAST SWITCH WITHOUT PROPER AUTHORITY. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CN / VIA OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TBS INVESTIGATORS (WINNIPEG) DEPLOYED.

CP FREIGHT 200-19, PULLING INTO THE SIDING AT CAMPAIGN, DERAILED 10 TANK CARS AT THE SOUTH SIDING SWITCH. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT 2 OF THE CARS CONTACTED THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE ON CP FREIGHT 465-19 WHO WAS STATIONARY ON THE MAIN TRACK. NO DANGEROUS GOODS INVOLVED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CP OFFICIALS RESPONDED.

CN REPORTS THAT A CUT OF 11 LOADED COAL CARS ROLLED UNCONTROLLED DOWN A 1% GRADE AND CONTACTED THE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST FROM FREIGHT A-459-51-16 STANDING AT MILE 49.20 OF THE GRANDE CACHE SUBDIVISION. AS A RESULT OF THE COLLISION, 3 LOCOMOTIVES AND THE 11 GONDOLAS DERAILED. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT AN EMPLOYEE ABOARD ONE OF THE LOCOMOTIVES SUSTAINED INJURIES AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO HOSPITAL. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TBS INVESTIGATOR (CALGARY) DEPLOYED.

CN FREIGHT M-301-41-20, WHILE PROCEEDING WESTWARD ON THE WAINWRIGHT SUBDIVISION, EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION AT MILE 145.71. UPON INSPECTION BY THE CREW, 31 COVERED HOPPER CARS, LOADED WITH BARLEY AND WHEAT, WERE DISCOVERED DERAILED. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT 17 OF THE CARS DERAILED AND FELL FROM THE FABYAN BRIDGE INTO THE RAVINE. NO INJURIES REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED.

VIA PASSENGER TRAIN 92, PROCEEDING EASTWARD ON CN'S OAKVILLE SUBDIVISION, DERAILED LOCOMOTIVE VIA 6444 AND ALL 5 COACHES IN THE VICINITY OF THE TRACK 2 TO 3 CROSSOVERS BLOCKING THE THREE MAIN TRACKS. IT WAS FURTHER REPORTED THAT THE LOCOMOTIVE STRUCK A BUILDING AFTER IT DERAILED. AS A RESULT OF THE DERAILMENT, ALL THREE CREW MEMBERS IN THE LOCOMOTIVE SUSTAINED FATAL INJURIES AND APPROXIMATELY 45 PASSENGERS SUSTAINED MINOR AND SERIOUS INJURIES. LOCAL EMERGENCY SERVICES AND CN / VIA OFFICIALS RESPONDED. TSB INVESTIGATORS (TORONTO, HEAD OFFICE) DEPLOYED.

CN REPORTS, FREIGHT A-416-51-13, WHILE PROCEEDING EASTWARD AT 15 MPH ON THE CLEARWATER SUBDIVISION, STRUCK A HI-RAIL TRUCK AT MILE 14.50. IT WAS REPORTED THAT THE MAINTANER WAS WORKING UNDER A TRACK OCCUPANCY PERMIT BETWEEN SIGNALS 134-N AND 159-N. NO INJURIES OR DERAILMENT REPORTED. CN OFFICIALS RESPONDED.
